content.title: Production Linked Incentive Scheme For Automobile And Auto Component Industry
content.details: The government of India has approved the scheme 'Production Linked Incentive Scheme for Automobile and Auto Components Industry' in India to enhance Indiaâ€™s Manufacturing Capabilities for Advanced Automotive Products. The scheme proposes financial incentives to boost domestic manufacturing of Advanced Automotive Technology products and attract investments in the automotive manufacturing value chain. Its prime objectives include overcoming cost disabilities, creating economies of scale, and building a robust supply chain in areas of Advanced Automotive Technology products. It will also generate employment.
benefits: Incentives for Champion OEM and New Non-Automotive (OEM) Investor company based on determined sales value.
Incentive slabs for Component Champion and New Non-Automotive (Component) Investor Company.
eligibility: For a company or its Group company(ies) with an existing presence in India or globally in the Automotive vehicle and components manufacturing business.
For new non-automotive investor companies or its Group company(ies) that may want to participate in this scheme.
exclusions: Proprietorship, Partnership, and Limited Liability Partnership (LLP) are not allowed under the scheme.
content.application_process: Online. The window for receiving applications through the Notice Inviting Applications will be for a period of 60 days.
documents_required: Memorandum & Articles of Association (Submitted to ROC)
Letter of Authorization by Board of Directors or Managing Director or Equivalent
Certificate from the Company Secretary of the Applicant / Managing Director for Credit History
Business Profile/ Corporate Presentation of the Applicant
Shareholding Pattern (Latest submitted with ROC and certified by the Company Secretary)
Self-Certification on Revenue/ Investment/ Net worth from each of the Group Company (ies)

faqs.question: Who is an applicant under the scheme?
faqs.answer: An applicant under the scheme is a company incorporated/ registered in India under the Companies Act, 2013, engaged in the automotive and/or auto component manufacturing sector or a New Non-Automotive Investor company.

faqs.question: What are the circumstances under which an applicant may be ineligible for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants whose accounts are declared as Non-Performing Asset (NPA) as per RBI guidelines or defaulter or wilful defaulter as per RBI/CIBIL or SEBI debarred list would be considered ineligible.
